title: International students sue over Trump admin revoking visas
author: Rachel Wolf

facts.content: International students are suing the Trump administration over visa revocations
Students argue the Trump administration lacked justification for canceling visas
President Trump has pursued a crackdown on immigration
Some international students have had visas revoked for pro-Palestinian activism
Some international students have had visas revoked for past infractions like traffic violations
Students in at least 30 states have had their visas revoked
The government is using a 1952 foreign policy statute to justify visa cancelations
Mahmoud Khalil is a Columbia University student involved in anti-Israel activity
A judge ruled the government met the burden of proof to deport Khalil
DHS attorneys said Khalil was not forthcoming about his organizational involvements
International students must meet specific requirements to obtain a U.S. student visa
DHS can revoke student visas for reasons like extended absence, expulsion, unauthorized employment, and failure to enroll
Students can sometimes maintain legal residency status after visa revocation
Losing legal residency status puts students at risk of deportation
Secretary of State Marco Rubio stated the government can cancel student visas under law
